forecast.name: Veterans Day
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain before 4pm. Mostly sunny. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 53 in the afternoon. West northwest wind around 17 mph, with gusts as high as 25 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly clear, with a low around 49. West northwest wind 7 to 13 mph, with gusts as high as 23 mph.

weather_report:
As the clock ticks past three in the afternoon, Downtown San Francisco embraces a day both hushed and expectant, draped in the kind of chill that teases the senses. The forecast hints at rain that has yet to materialize, leaving a crispness in the air, punctuated by a gusty breeze from the west-northwest. While the clouds above billow, their gray faces hold the promise of a brief but lively shower; a 90% chance of precipitation hangs like a thick curtain. Yet, for now, the city maintains a hesitant clarity, filtered through a thin layer of moisture that softens the usual sharpness of its skyline.

As evening approaches, the allure of the outdoors beckons—ideal for those who appreciate a brisk walk wrapped in layers. The golden hues of the post-rain sun are yet to emerge, leaving the streets cool and inviting for a leisurely stroll or a visit to a cozy café. The breeze will whisper through light jackets and perhaps a scarf, keeping warmth close as temperatures dip into the evening. With the city wearing its subdued palette and moments of brilliance teasing the horizon, the day holds itself in a gentle balance—one perfect for savoring the mysteries of the San Francisco twilight.
